    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      byte changeAccessRightKeyNo
      The reference number of the key,which is necessary to be authenticated with in order to change the access rights for the file and to link each access right to key numbers
      byte communicationSettings
      Communication settings: 0x00 or 0x02 --- Plain communication 0x01 --- Plain communication secured by MACing 0x03 --- Fully enciphered communication
      int initValue
      the initial value of this value file
      byte limitedCreditEnabled
      if the LimitedCredit command is allowed for this file (0x00 for disabled, 0x01 for enabled)
      int lowerimit
      Lower limit of the value file
      byte readAccessRightKeyNo
      Access right capability, 0x0E means free access, and 0x0F means deny access.
      byte readAndWriteAccessRightKeyNo
      Access right capability, 0x0E means free access, and 0x0F means deny access.
      int upperimit
      Upper limit of the value file
      byte writeAccessRightKeyNo
      Access right capability, 0x0E means free access, and 0x0F means deny access.

    • Field Detail

      • communicationSettings

        public byte communicationSettings
        Communication settings: 0x00 or 0x02 --- Plain communication 0x01 --- Plain communication secured by MACing 0x03 --- Fully enciphered communication

      • readAccessRightKeyNo

        public byte readAccessRightKeyNo
        Access right capability, 0x0E means free access, and 0x0F means deny access. the reference number of the key which needs to be authenticated prior to Read Access and Read&Write Access

      • writeAccessRightKeyNo

        public byte writeAccessRightKeyNo
        Access right capability, 0x0E means free access, and 0x0F means deny access. the reference number of the key which needs to be authentication prior to Write Access and Read&Write Access

      • readAndWriteAccessRightKeyNo

        public byte readAndWriteAccessRightKeyNo
        Access right capability, 0x0E means free access, and 0x0F means deny access. the reference number of the key which needs to be authentication prior to Read&Write Access

      • changeAccessRightKeyNo

        public byte changeAccessRightKeyNo
        The reference number of the key,which is necessary to be authenticated with in order to change the access rights for the file and to link each access right to key numbers

      • lowerimit

        Lower limit of the value file

      • upperimit

        Upper limit of the value file

        the initial value of this value file

      • limitedCreditEnabled
